b'Amazed to see the creation debate passed 10 million views. Spinning impossible yarns in which Earth is only 4,000 years old was silly; it\xe2\x80\x99s still silly. Science rules.'
b'Nathaniel Bowditch is a personal hero of mine. He helped create our modern GPS connected world. Happy 250th Orbit of the Sun. Carry on Mr. Bowditch. https://t.co/4NrjkMCSGm'

b'Our LightSail 2 mission ended after 3 1/2 years. We raised the orbit, advanced space technology, and took astonishing pictures. Thanks LightSail! https://t.co/1yoL0lRuTe'
b'RT @exploreplanets: It\xe2\x80\x99s official: LightSail 2 has reentered Earth\xe2\x80\x99s atmosphere and burned up, as expected. What a phenomenal mission this\xe2\x80\xa6'

b'Astronomy 102 with Carl Sagan at @Cornell gave me a deep appreciation for the Cosmos and changed my life. It led to my leading The Planetary Society (@exploreplanets). Happy 88th Orbit of the Sun, Carl! #CarlSaganDay https://t.co/w2DkcNQZuU'
b"Greetings Gen-Z squad members. Vote! Earth's climate and the right to vote are in your hands-- with your ballots. You are the key. #VOTE! https://t.co/lF9ASjZnQx"

b'Today is #WorldPolioDay\xe2\x80\x94 a day that means a lot to me. One of my friends in elementary school had polio. It\xe2\x80\x99s crippling. We have almost eliminated the disease\xe2\x80\x94 almost. Vaccines Rule! You can help #EndPolio at last. Learn more: https://t.co/Ss6Z9eUM8b'

b'Start with a new sharper look at the enormous \xe2\x80\x9cPillars of Creation" in the distant Eagle Nebula. Wrap with a set of links that keep you up to date with what\xe2\x80\x99s up out there in space. @exploreplanets  https://t.co/t9UI1XIzl9'

b'The Postal Service has a new stamp honoring the women cryptologists, who broke the codes in World War II. Women had never been trusted with such high-level work, let alone counted on to win a war. My mom was one of them. She carried the secrets to her grave. Thank you all. https://t.co/tl4GqIvbkR'

b"Fellow Earthlings, this just in: @NASA guided DART into asteroid Dimorphos, at 14,000 mph, changing the orbit many minutes more than expected. We're celebrating here at @exploreplanets because a mission like this could save the world. https://t.co/snsduOEQ6g"

b"Tonight, the world's first planetary defense test will take place, the Double Asteroid Redirection Test. At 7:14pm ET, DART\xe2\x80\x99s impact will slow Dimorphos down, which will make it orbit Didymos faster. This technique could save Earth one day - the only preventable natural disaster. https://t.co/N5gnDSydu6"
